page.title: 14FORT BOVISAND
page.content: {Fort Bovisand Underwater Centre}is the {largest diving training school in {Europe and possibly the world. Over {1000 students worldwide but mostly {from the U.K. pass through every year. There are over 60 people employed here.Training facilities include:a decompression chamber,underwater welding and commercial equipment,using explosives,photography,clearing,survi- val,concreting,inspection,bell diving, and deep work.{The fort was originally {built 1845 to 1847,to defend Plymouth {against future attack by the French. During WW2 gun emplacements were built but were not finished before the end of the war.{The MOD owned the Fort {until 1970 when it was bought by {Plymouth Ocean Projects Ltd.}They have built laboratories, lecture rooms,diving equipment shops, accommodation,stores, and offices.
